alert.note: Alert for Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 12:47PM PST until February 22 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, but winds could gust as high as 50 mph with significant blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Far Northern Klamath County, mainly along Highway 97 from the intersection of Highway 138 northward to Crescent and La Pine. * WHEN...From late Monday night through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
